title_full:
MORTON FELDMAN

              —
              Patterns In A Chromatic Field
            
              (Tzadik)
label: Tzadik
description:
80:42 minutes from the late minimalist composer Morton Feldman.

This piece dates from 1981 and snaps into your headspace via a layering of notes and tones alongside solo cello and piano instrumentation.

Though heavily notated there are elements of improvisation in the playing by Charles Curtis and Aleck Karis. Not an easy listen by any means but get... more

label: RECOLLECTION GRM
description:
Recollections GRM collect four pieces by one of the 20th century's most important avant-garde musicians and thinkers for one of their most anticipated editions: Iannis Xenakis' 'GRM Works 1957-1962'. 

Xennakis co-founded the GRM in 1958 (the same year he designed the Philips Pavilion for the Brussels World Fair) and created a peerless body of work uniting... more

label: Blank Forms Editions
description:
Issued posthumously, ‘Petra (1991) For Two Pianos’ is the first ever vinyl pressing of music by Maryanne Amacher (1938-2009), one of the early “gurus” of electronic music, who is revered for her explorations of “otoacoustic emissions” - acoustic phenomena where the listener’s ears produce audible sound.

One of a handful of Maryanne’s works for tape, ‘Petra... more

release: Ethnic Minority Music of Southern China
title_full:
Various

              —
              Ethnic Minority Music of Southern China
            
              (Sublime Frequencies)
label: Sublime Frequencies
description: "The 5th Sublime Frequencies volume in Laurent Jeanneau’s amazing documentation of vanishing indigenous music of the rural Asian frontiers, this release focuses on ethnic minority groups of Southern China. Presented here are 17 tracks of supremely infectious vocals and folkloric instrumentals played on a wide variety of local traditional instruments. The... more

title_full:
PAULINE OLIVEROS

              —
              Early Electronic Works 1959-66
            
              (Sub Rosa)
label: Sub Rosa
description: Knockout collection of Pauline Oliveros' early electronic Works cataloguing her contribution to the tape and electronic music of the late 1950s and 1960s through a systematic exploration of sounds and techniques, including electronics (oscillators, tape recorders, buchla box series 100), but also found objects (soup ladles, table knife) and voice.
